meanings.sent1: The prinkers at the party wore fancy clothes.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of prinkers getting ready for the fashion show.
meanings.sent3: The prinkers compared their stylish outfits and laughed.
meanings.sent4: She stood out in the crowd like a prinkers in a sea of plain dressers.
meanings.sent5: The little girl wanted to be a prinkers when she grew up, always dressing up in sparkly clothes.

meanings.sent1: Her prinkers took hours before the big event.
meanings.sent2: The prinkers in front of the mirror seemed endless.
meanings.sent3: The prinkers of the models backstage caused a delay in the show.
meanings.sent4: The prinkers of the birds in the morning light was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The prinkers of the flowers opening up in the spring was a sign of new life.

meanings.definition: Prinkers: to prink or dress up in a showy manner
meanings.sent1: She prinkers herself in bright colors for the party.
meanings.sent2: The peacock prinkers its feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent3: He prinkers in his best suit for the job interview.
meanings.sent4: The tree prinkers itself with colorful leaves in the fall.
meanings.sent5: The princess prinkers in a gown made of shimmering fabric for the royal ball.
